standard_metadata.standard_description: Use informal arguments to establish facts about the angle sum and exterior angle of triangles, about the angles created when parallel lines are cut by a transversal, and the angle-angle criterion for similarity of triangles.

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad  \blueD{\angle A=7x + 24^\circ} $ $\qquad \greenD{\angle B=3x + 92^\circ} $      **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\blueD{\angle A}$:**  $\blueD{\angle A} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the top, left angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A. Where the third line crosses the right most parallel line, the top, left angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle A}$ and $\greenD{\angle B}$ are corresponding angles. Since corresponding angles are congruent, we can set their measures equal to one another.    $\blueD{7x + 24^\circ} = \greenD{3x + 92^\circ}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(7x + 24^\circ) \maroonD{- 3x} &= (3x + 92^\circ) \maroonD{- 3x} \\\\  4x + 24^\circ&= 92^\circ  \\\\  (4x + 24^\circ) \maroonD{- 24^\circ} &= 92^\circ \maroonD{- 24^\circ} \\\\  4x& = 68^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{4x}{\maroonD{4}} &= \dfrac{68^\circ}{\maroonD{4}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{17^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\blueD{\angle A}$:  $\begin{align}\blueD{\angle A}  &=  \blueD{7x + 24^\circ} \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=\blueD7(\goldD{17}) \blueD{+ 24}  \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=  \blueD{143 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad  \blueD{\angle A=7x + 40^\circ} $ $\qquad\greenD{\angle B=3x + 112^\circ}  $      **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\blueD{\angle A}$:**  $\blueD{\angle A} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the top, left angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B. Where the third line crosses the right most parallel line, the top, left angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle A}$ and $\greenD{\angle B}$ are corresponding angles. Since corresponding angles are congruent, we can set their measures equal to one another.    $\blueD{7x + 40^\circ} = \greenD{3x + 112^\circ}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(7x + 40^\circ) \maroonD{- 3x} &= (3x + 112^\circ) \maroonD{- 3x} \\\\  4x + 40^\circ&= 112^\circ  \\\\  (4x + 40^\circ) \maroonD{- 40^\circ} &= 112^\circ \maroonD{- 40^\circ} \\\\  4x& = 72^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{4x}{\maroonD{4}} &= \dfrac{72^\circ}{\maroonD{4}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{18^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\blueD{\angle A}$:  $\begin{align}\blueD{\angle A}  &=  \blueD{7x + 40^\circ} \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=\blueD7(\goldD{18}) \blueD{+ 40}  \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=  \blueD{166 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad \blueD{\angle A = 6x + 12^\circ} $ $\qquad\greenD{\angle B = 3x + 63^\circ}$     **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\blueD{\angle A}$:**  $\blueD{\angle A} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the top parallel line, the top, left angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A. Where the third line crosses the bottom parallel line, the top, left angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle A}$ and $\greenD{\angle B}$ are corresponding angles. Since corresponding angles are congruent, we can set their measures equal to one another.    $\blueD{6x + 12^\circ} = \greenD{3x + 63^\circ}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(6x + 12^\circ) \maroonD{- 3x} &= (3x + 63^\circ) \maroonD{- 3x} \\\\  3x + 12^\circ&= 63^\circ  \\\\  (3x + 12^\circ) \maroonD{- 12^\circ} &= 63^\circ \maroonD{- 12^\circ} \\\\  3x& = 51^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{3x}{\maroonD{3}} &= \dfrac{51^\circ}{\maroonD{3}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{17^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\blueD{\angle A}$:  $\begin{align}\blueD{\angle A}  &=  \blueD{6x + 12^\circ} \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=\blueD6(\goldD{17}) \blueD{+ 12}  \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=  \blueD{114 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad \blueD{\angle A= 5x - 5^\circ} $ $\qquad \greenD{\angle B= 3x + 13^\circ}  $      **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\greenD{\angle B}$:**  $\greenD{\angle B} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the bottom, left angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A. Where the third line crosses the right most parallel line, the bottom, left angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle A}$ and $\greenD{\angle B}$ are corresponding angles. Since corresponding angles are congruent, we can set their measures equal to one another.    $\blueD{5x -5^\circ} = \greenD{3x + 13^\circ}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(5x -5^\circ) \maroonD{- 3x} &= (3x + 13^\circ) \maroonD{- 3x} \\\\  2x -5^\circ&= 13^\circ  \\\\  (2x -5^\circ) \maroonD{+ 5^\circ} &= 13^\circ \maroonD{+ 5^\circ} \\\\  2x& = 18^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{2x}{\maroonD{2}} &= \dfrac{18^\circ}{\maroonD{2}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{9^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\greenD{\angle B}$:  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle B}  &=  \greenD{3x + 13^\circ} \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=\greenD3(\goldD{9}) \greenD{+ 13}  \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=  \greenD{40 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad \blueD{\angle A = 8x -8^\circ} $ $\qquad \greenD{\angle B=5x + 25^\circ} $     **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\greenD{\angle B}$:**  $\greenD{\angle B} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the top, left angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B. Where the third line crosses the right most parallel line, the top, left angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle A}$ and $\greenD{\angle B}$ are corresponding angles. Since corresponding angles are congruent, we can set their measures equal to one another.    $\blueD{8x -8^\circ} = \greenD{5x + 25^\circ}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(8x -8^\circ) \maroonD{- 5x} &= (5x + 25^\circ) \maroonD{- 5x} \\\\  3x -8^\circ&= 25^\circ  \\\\  (3x -8^\circ) \maroonD{+ 8^\circ} &= 25^\circ \maroonD{+ 8^\circ} \\\\  3x& = 33^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{3x}{\maroonD{3}} &= \dfrac{33^\circ}{\maroonD{3}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{11^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\greenD{\angle B}$:  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle B}  &=  \greenD{5x + 25^\circ} \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=\greenD5(\goldD{11}) \greenD{+ 25}  \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=  \greenD{80 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad  \blueD{\angle A=6x + 5^\circ} $ $\qquad\green{\angle B=4x + 45^\circ}  $         **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\blueD{\angle A}$:**  $\blueD{\angle A} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the top parallel line, the bottom, left angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A. Where the third line crosses the bottom parallel line, the top, right most angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle A}$ and $\greenD{\angle B}$ are alternate interior angles. Therefore, we can set their measures equal to one another.    $\blueD{6x + 5^\circ} = \greenD{4x + 45^\circ}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(6x + 5^\circ) \maroonD{- 4x} &= (4x + 45^\circ) \maroonD{- 4x} \\\\  2x + 5^\circ&= 45^\circ  \\\\  (2x + 5^\circ) \maroonD{- 5^\circ} &= 45^\circ \maroonD{- 5^\circ} \\\\  2x& = 40^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{2x}{\maroonD{2}} &= \dfrac{40^\circ}{\maroonD{2}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{20^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\blueD{\angle A}$:  $\begin{align}\blueD{\angle A}  &=  \blueD{6x + 5^\circ} \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=\blueD6(\goldD{20}) \blueD{+ 5}  \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=  \blueD{125 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad  \blueD{\angle A=5x -18^\circ} $ $\qquad \green{\angle B=3x + 42^\circ}  $         **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\blueD{\angle A}$:**  $\blueD{\angle A} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the top parallel line, the bottom angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B. Where the third line crosses the bottom parallel line, the top angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle A}$ and $\greenD{\angle B}$ are alternate interior angles. Therefore, we can set their measures equal to one another.    $\blueD{5x -18^\circ} = \greenD{3x + 42^\circ}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(5x -18^\circ) \maroonD{- 3x} &= (3x + 42^\circ) \maroonD{- 3x} \\\\  2x -18^\circ&= 42^\circ  \\\\  (2x -18^\circ) \maroonD{+18^\circ} &= 42^\circ \maroonD{+18^\circ} \\\\  2x& = 60^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{2x}{\maroonD{2}} &= \dfrac{60^\circ}{\maroonD{2}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{30^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\blueD{\angle A}$:  $\begin{align}\blueD{\angle A}  &=  \blueD{5x -18^\circ} \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=\blueD5(\goldD{30}) \blueD{-18}  \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=  \blueD{132 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad \blueD{\angle A=5x -12^\circ} $ $\qquad \green{\angle B=2x + 24^\circ}  $       **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\greenD{\angle B}$:**  $\greenD{\angle B} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the top, right most angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A. Where the third line crosses the right most parallel line, the bottom, left angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle A}$ and $\greenD{\angle B}$ are alternate interior angles. Therefore, we can set their measures equal to one another.    $\blueD{5x -12^\circ} = \greenD{2x + 24^\circ}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(5x -12^\circ) \maroonD{- 2x} &= (2x + 24^\circ) \maroonD{- 2x} \\\\  3x -12^\circ&= 24^\circ  \\\\  (3x -12^\circ) \maroonD{+12^\circ} &= 24^\circ \maroonD{+12^\circ} \\\\  3x& = 36^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{3x}{\maroonD{3}} &= \dfrac{36^\circ}{\maroonD{3}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{12^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\greenD{\angle B}$:  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle B}  &=  \greenD{2x + 24^\circ} \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=\greenD2(\goldD{12}) \greenD{+ 24}  \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=  \greenD{48 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad \blueD{\angle A=8x +78^\circ} $ $\qquad \green{\angle B=2x + 114^\circ}  $       **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\greenD{\angle B}$:**  $\greenD{\angle B} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the top parallel line, the bottom angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B. Where the third line crosses the bottom parallel line, the top angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle A}$ and $\greenD{\angle B}$ are alternate interior angles. Therefore, we can set their measures equal to one another.    $\blueD{8x +78^\circ} = \greenD{2x + 114^\circ}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(8x +78^\circ) \maroonD{- 2x} &= (2x + 114^\circ) \maroonD{- 2x} \\\\  6x +78^\circ&= 114^\circ  \\\\  (6x +78^\circ) \maroonD{-78^\circ} &= 114^\circ \maroonD{-78^\circ} \\\\  6x& = 36^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{6x}{\maroonD{6}} &= \dfrac{36^\circ}{\maroonD{6}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{6^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\greenD{\angle B}$:  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle B}  &=  \greenD{2x + 114^\circ} \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=\greenD2(\goldD{6}) \greenD{+ 114}  \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=  \greenD{126 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad  \blueD{\angle A=8x -10^\circ} $ $\qquad \green{\angle B=3x + 90^\circ}  $       **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\greenD{\angle B}$:**  $\greenD{\angle B} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the top parallel line, the bottom, right most angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A. Where the third line crosses the bottom parallel line, the top, left angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle A}$ and $\greenD{\angle B}$ are alternate interior angles. Therefore, we can set their measures equal to one another.    $\blueD{8x -10^\circ} = \greenD{3x + 90^\circ}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(8x -10^\circ) \maroonD{- 3x} &= (3x + 90^\circ) \maroonD{- 3x} \\\\  5x -10^\circ&= 90^\circ  \\\\  (5x -10^\circ) \maroonD{+10^\circ} &= 90^\circ \maroonD{+10^\circ} \\\\  5x& = 100^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{5x}{\maroonD{5}} &= \dfrac{100^\circ}{\maroonD{5}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{20^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\greenD{\angle B}$:  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle B}  &=  \greenD{3x + 90^\circ} \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=\greenD3(\goldD{20}) \greenD{+ 90}  \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=  \greenD{150 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad  \blueD{\angle A=10x +24^\circ} $ $\qquad \green{\angle B=6x + 72^\circ}  $       **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\blueD{\angle A}$:**  $\blueD{\angle A} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the top, left angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A. Where the third line crosses the right most parallel line, the bottom, right most angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle A}$ and $\greenD{\angle B}$ are alternate exterior angles. Therefore, we can set their measures equal to one another.    $\blueD{10x +24^\circ} = \greenD{6x + 72^\circ}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(10x +24^\circ) \maroonD{- 6x} &= (6x + 72^\circ) \maroonD{- 6x} \\\\  4x +24^\circ&= 72^\circ  \\\\  (4x +24^\circ) \maroonD{-24^\circ} &= 72^\circ \maroonD{-24^\circ} \\\\  4x& = 48^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{4x}{\maroonD{4}} &= \dfrac{48^\circ}{\maroonD{4}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{12^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\blueD{\angle A}$:  $\begin{align}\blueD{\angle A}  &=  \blueD{10x + 24^\circ} \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=\blueD{10}(\goldD{12}) \blueD{+ 24}  \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=  \blueD{144 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad  \blueD{\angle A} = \blueD{6x -2 ^\circ} $ $\qquad \green{\angle B} = \green{4x +48^\circ} $      **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\blueD{\angle A}$:**  $\blueD{\angle A} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the top parallel line, the top, left angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A. Where the third line crosses the bottom parallel line, the bottom, right most angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle A}$ and $\greenD{\angle B}$ are alternate exterior angles. Therefore, we can set their measures equal to one another.    $\blueD{6x -2^\circ} = \greenD{4x  +48^\circ}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(6x -2^\circ) \maroonD{- 4x} &= (4x + 48^\circ) \maroonD{- 4x} \\\\  2x -2^\circ&= 48^\circ  \\\\  (2x -2^\circ) \maroonD{+2^\circ} &= 48^\circ \maroonD{+2^\circ} \\\\  2x& = 50^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{2x}{\maroonD{2}} &= \dfrac{50^\circ}{\maroonD{2}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{25^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\blueD{\angle A}$:  $\begin{align}\blueD{\angle A}  &=  \blueD{6x -2^\circ} \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=\blueD{6}(\goldD{25}) \blueD{-2}  \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=  \blueD{148 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad  \blueD{\angle A} = \blueD{6x +18 ^\circ} $ $\qquad \green{\angle B} = \green{x +93^\circ}  $       **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\greenD{\angle B}$:**  $\greenD{\angle B} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the top parallel line, the top, right most angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A. Where the third line crosses the bottom parallel line, the bottom, left angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle A}$ and $\greenD{\angle B}$ are alternate exterior angles. Therefore, we can set their measures equal to one another.    $\blueD{6x +18^\circ} = \greenD{x  +93^\circ}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(6x +18^\circ) \maroonD{- x} &= (x + 93^\circ) \maroonD{- x} \\\\  5x +18^\circ&= 93^\circ  \\\\  (5x +18^\circ) \maroonD{-18^\circ} &= 93^\circ \maroonD{-18^\circ} \\\\  5x& = 75^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{5x}{\maroonD{5}} &= \dfrac{75^\circ}{\maroonD{5}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{15^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\greenD{\angle B}$:  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle B}  &=  \greenD{x + 93^\circ} \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=\greenD(\goldD{15}) \greenD{+ 93}  \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=  \greenD{108 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad  \blueD{\angle A} = \blueD{8x +6 ^\circ} $ $\qquad \green{\angle B} = \green{4x +38^\circ}  $       **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\greenD{\angle B}$:**  $\greenD{\angle B} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the top, right most angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A. Where the third line crosses the right most parallel line, the bottom, left angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle A}$ and $\greenD{\angle B}$ are alternate exterior angles. Therefore, we can set their measures equal to one another.    $\blueD{8x +6^\circ} = \greenD{4x  +38^\circ}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(8x +6^\circ) \maroonD{- 4x} &= (4x + 38^\circ) \maroonD{- 4x} \\\\  4x +6^\circ&= 38^\circ  \\\\  (4x +6^\circ) \maroonD{-6^\circ} &= 38^\circ \maroonD{-6^\circ} \\\\  4x& = 32^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{4x}{\maroonD{4}} &= \dfrac{32^\circ}{\maroonD{4}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{8^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\greenD{\angle B}$:  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle B}  &=  \greenD{4x + 38^\circ} \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=\greenD4(\goldD{8}) \greenD{+ 38}  \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=  \greenD{70 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad \blueD{\angle A} = \blueD{5x -15 ^\circ} $ $\qquad \green{\angle B} = \green{2x +21^\circ} $       **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\greenD{\angle B}$:**  $\greenD{\angle B} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the bottom, left angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A. Where the third line crosses the right most parallel line, the top, right most angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle A}$ and $\greenD{\angle B}$ are alternate exterior angles. Therefore, we can set their measures equal to one another.    $\blueD{5x -15^\circ} = \greenD{2x  +21^\circ}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(5x -15^\circ) \maroonD{- 2x} &= (2x + 21^\circ) \maroonD{- 2x} \\\\  3x -15^\circ&= 21^\circ  \\\\  (3x -15^\circ) \maroonD{+15^\circ} &= 21^\circ \maroonD{+15^\circ} \\\\  3x& = 36^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{3x}{\maroonD{3}} &= \dfrac{36^\circ}{\maroonD{3}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{12^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\greenD{\angle B}$:  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle B}  &=  \greenD{2x + 21^\circ} \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=\greenD2(\goldD{12}) \greenD{+ 21}  \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=  \greenD{45 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad  \blueD{\angle A} = \blueD{5x +34^\circ} $ $\qquad \green{\angle B} = \green{2x +76^\circ} $       **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\blueD{\angle A}$:**  $\blueD{\angle A} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the top, right most angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B. Where the third line crosses the right most parallel line, the top, left angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A.

hints.content: We can label the angle adjacent with $\blueD{\angle A}$ as $\purpleD{\angle C}$. Because these two angles form a straight line, we know they are supplementary.   $\blueD{5x + 34^\circ} + \purpleD{\angle C} = 180^\circ$      [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the top, right most angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B. Where the third line crosses the right most parallel line, the top, left angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A. Where the third line crosses the right most parallel line, the top, right most angle measure has a curved purple line and is labeled C.

hints.content: $\greenD{\angle B}$ and $\purpleD{\angle C}$ are corresponding angles, so $\greenD{\angle B} =\purpleD{\angle C}$  $\begin{align}\blueD{5x + 34^\circ} + \purpleD{\angle C}  &=  180^\circ   \\\\  \blueD{5x + 34^\circ} + \greenD{\angle B} &=180^\circ   \\\\   \blueD{5x + 34^\circ} +\greenD{2x +76^\circ} &=  180^\circ\end{align}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(5x +34^\circ) +(2x + 76^\circ) &= 180^\circ   \\\\ (5x + 2x) + (34^\circ + 76^\circ)&= 180^\circ  \\\\ 7x +110^\circ &= 180^\circ\\\\ (7x + 110)  \maroonD{-110^\circ}& = 180^\circ \maroonD{-110^\circ} \\\\ 7x & = 70^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{7x}{\maroonD{7}} &= \dfrac{70^\circ}{\maroonD{7}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{10^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\blueD{\angle A}$:  $\begin{align}\blueD{\angle A}  &=  \blueD{5x + 34^\circ} \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=\blueD{5}(\goldD{10}) \blueD{+ 34}  \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=  \blueD{84 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad \blueD{\angle A} = \blueD{5x +20^\circ}$ $\qquad \green{\angle B} = \green{9x -92^\circ} $       **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\blueD{\angle A}$:**  $\blueD{\angle A} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the right most angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A. Where the third line crosses the right most parallel line, the top angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B.

hints.content: We can label the angle adjacent with $\blueD{\angle A}$ as $\purpleD{\angle C}$. Because these two angles form a straight line, we know they are supplementary.   $\blueD{5x + 20^\circ} + \purpleD{\angle C} = 180^\circ$      [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the right most angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A. Where the third line crosses the right most parallel line, the top angle measure has a curved purple line and is labeled C. Where the third line crosses the right most parallel line, the top angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B.

hints.content: $\greenD{\angle B}$ and $\purpleD{\angle C}$ are corresponding angles, so $\greenD{\angle B} =\purpleD{\angle C}$  $\begin{align}\blueD{5x + 20^\circ} + \purpleD{\angle C}  &=  180^\circ   \\\\  \blueD{5x + 20^\circ} + \greenD{\angle B} &=180^\circ   \\\\   \blueD{5x + 20^\circ} +\greenD{9x -92^\circ} &=  180^\circ\end{align}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(5x +20^\circ) +(9x -92^\circ) &= 180^\circ   \\\\ (5x + 9x) + (20^\circ -92^\circ)&= 180^\circ  \\\\ 14x -72^\circ &= 180^\circ\\\\ (14x -72) \maroonD{+72^\circ}& = 180^\circ \maroonD{+72^\circ} \\\\ 14x & = 252^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{14x}{\maroonD{14}} &= \dfrac{252^\circ}{\maroonD{14}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{18^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\blueD{\angle A}$:  $\begin{align}\blueD{\angle A}  &=  \blueD{5x + 20^\circ} \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=\blueD{5}(\goldD{18}) \blueD{+ 20}  \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=  \blueD{110 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad  \blueD{\angle A} = \blueD{6x -35^\circ} $ $\qquad \green{\angle B} = \green{3x +53^\circ} $       **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\blueD{\angle A}$:**  $\blueD{\angle A} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the bottom, left angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B. Where the third line crosses the right most parallel line, the top, left angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A.

hints.content: We can label the angle adjacent with $\blueD{\angle A}$ as $\purpleD{\angle C}$. Because these two angles form a straight line, we know they are supplementary.   $\blueD{6x -35^\circ} + \purpleD{\angle C} = 180^\circ$     [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the bottom, left angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B. Where the third line crosses the right most parallel line, the top, left angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A. Where the third line crosses the right most parallel line, the bottom, left angle measure has a curved purple line and is labeled C.

hints.content: $\greenD{\angle B}$ and $\purpleD{\angle C}$ are corresponding angles, so $\greenD{\angle B} =\purpleD{\angle C}$  $\begin{align}\blueD{6x -35^\circ} + \purpleD{\angle C}  &=  180^\circ   \\\\  \blueD{6x -35^\circ} + \greenD{\angle B} &=180^\circ   \\\\   \blueD{6x -35^\circ} +\greenD{3x +53^\circ} &=  180^\circ\end{align}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(6x -35^\circ) +(3x +53^\circ) &= 180^\circ   \\\\ (6x + 3x) + (-35^\circ +53^\circ)&= 180^\circ  \\\\ 9x +18^\circ &= 180^\circ\\\\ (9x +18) \maroonD{-18^\circ}& = 180^\circ \maroonD{-18^\circ} \\\\ 9x & = 162^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{9x}{\maroonD{9}} &= \dfrac{162^\circ}{\maroonD{9}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{18^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\blueD{\angle A}$:  $\begin{align}\blueD{\angle A}  &=  \blueD{6x -35^\circ} \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=\blueD{6}(\goldD{18}) \blueD{-35}  \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=  \blueD{73 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad \blueD{\angle A} = \blueD{8x  + 74^\circ}$ $\qquad \green{\angle B} = \green{2x +56^\circ}  $      **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\greenD{\angle B}$:**  $\greenD{\angle B} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the top parallel line, the bottom, left angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A. Where the third line crosses the bottom parallel line, the top, left angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B.

hints.content: We can label the angle adjacent with $\blueD{\angle A}$ as $\purpleD{\angle C}$. Because these two angles form a straight line, we know they are supplementary.   $\blueD{8x + 74^\circ} + \purpleD{\angle C} = 180^\circ$     [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the top parallel line, the bottom, left angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A. Where the third line crosses the top parallel line, the top, left angle measure has a curved purple line and is labeled C. Where the third line crosses the bottom parallel line, the top, left angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B.

hints.content: $\greenD{\angle B}$ and $\purpleD{\angle C}$ are corresponding angles, so $\greenD{\angle B} =\purpleD{\angle C}$  $\begin{align}\blueD{8x + 74^\circ} + \purpleD{\angle C}  &=  180^\circ   \\\\  \blueD{8x + 74^\circ} + \greenD{\angle B} &=180^\circ   \\\\   \blueD{8x + 74^\circ} +\greenD{2x +56^\circ} &=  180^\circ\end{align}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(8x + 74^\circ) +(2x +56^\circ) &= 180^\circ   \\\\ (8x + 2x) + (74^\circ +56^\circ)&= 180^\circ  \\\\ 10x +130^\circ &= 180^\circ\\\\ (10x +130) \maroonD{-130^\circ}& = 180^\circ \maroonD{-130^\circ} \\\\ 10x & = 50^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{10x}{\maroonD{10}} &= \dfrac{50^\circ}{\maroonD{10}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{5^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\greenD{\angle B}$:  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle B}  &=  \greenD{2x + 56^\circ} \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=\greenD2(\goldD{5}) \greenD{+ 56}  \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=  \greenD{66 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad  \blueD{\angle A} = \blueD{6x  - 48^\circ} $ $\qquad \green{\angle B} = \green{4x +38^\circ}  $      **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\greenD{\angle B}$:**  $\greenD{\angle B} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the bottom, right most angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the bottom, left angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A.

hints.content: We can label the angle adjacent with $\blueD{\angle A}$ as $\purpleD{\angle C}$. Because these two angles form a straight line, we know they are supplementary.   $\blueD{6x -48^\circ} + \purpleD{\angle C} = 180^\circ$     [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the bottom, right most angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the bottom, left angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the bottom, right most angle measure has a curved purple line and is labeled C.

hints.content: $\greenD{\angle B}$ and $\purpleD{\angle C}$ are corresponding angles, so $\greenD{\angle B} =\purpleD{\angle C}$  $\begin{align}\blueD{6x -48^\circ} + \purpleD{\angle C}  &=  180^\circ   \\\\  \blueD{6x -48^\circ} + \greenD{\angle B} &=180^\circ   \\\\   \blueD{6x -48^\circ} +\greenD{4x +38^\circ} &=  180^\circ\end{align}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(6x -48^\circ) +(4x +38^\circ) &= 180^\circ   \\\\ (6x + 4x) + (-48^\circ +38^\circ)&= 180^\circ  \\\\ 10x -10^\circ &= 180^\circ\\\\ (10x -10) \maroonD{+10^\circ}& = 180^\circ \maroonD{+10^\circ} \\\\ 10x & = 190^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{10x}{\maroonD{10}} &= \dfrac{190^\circ}{\maroonD{10}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{19^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\greenD{\angle B}$:  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle B}  &=  \greenD{4x + 38^\circ} \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=\greenD4(\goldD{19}) \greenD{+ 38}  \\\\ \greenD{\angle B} &=  \greenD{114 ^\circ} \end{align}$

question.content: The angle measurements in the diagram are represented by the following expressions.  $\qquad  \blueD{\angle A} = \blueD{6x  - 18^\circ} $ $\qquad \green{\angle B} = \green{14x +38^\circ}  $       **Solve for $x$ and then find the measure of $\blueD{\angle A}$:**  $\blueD{\angle A} = $  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the bottom, right most angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the bottom, left angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A.

hints.content: We can label the angle adjacent with $\blueD{\angle A}$ as $\purpleD{\angle C}$. Because these two angles form a straight line, we know they are supplementary.   $\blueD{6x -18^\circ} + \purpleD{\angle C} = 180^\circ$    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the bottom, right most angle measure has a curved green line and is labeled B. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the bottom, left angle measure has a curved blue line and is labeled A. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the bottom, right most angle measure has a curved purple line and is labeled C.

hints.content: $\greenD{\angle B}$ and $\purpleD{\angle C}$ are corresponding angles, so $\greenD{\angle B} =\purpleD{\angle C}$  $\begin{align}\blueD{6x -18^\circ} + \purpleD{\angle C}  &=  180^\circ   \\\\  \blueD{6x -18^\circ} + \greenD{\angle B} &=180^\circ   \\\\   \blueD{6x -18^\circ} +\greenD{14x +38^\circ} &=  180^\circ\end{align}$

Solve for $x$:     $\begin{align}(6x -18^\circ) +(14x +38^\circ) &= 180^\circ   \\\\ (6x + 14x) + (-18^\circ +38^\circ)&= 180^\circ  \\\\ 20x +20^\circ &= 180^\circ\\\\ (20x +20) \maroonD{-20^\circ}& = 180^\circ \maroonD{-20^\circ} \\\\ 20x & = 160^\circ \\\\  \dfrac{20x}{\maroonD{20}} &= \dfrac{160^\circ}{\maroonD{20}} \\\\ x& = \goldD{8^\circ} \end{align}$

Now, we substitute the value of $x$ into the expression for the measurement of $\blueD{\angle A}$:  $\begin{align}\blueD{\angle A}  &=  \blueD{6x -18^\circ} \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=\blueD{6}(\goldD{8}) \blueD{-18}  \\\\ \blueD{\angle A} &=  \blueD{30 ^\circ} \end{align}$
